Qualifiers.scope: Rear primary daylight plane (geometry and measurement)
applicability: Applies to rear-facing building massing subject to the rear primary daylight plane.
Measurement reference for the rear daylight plane is the rear setback line.
exclusions: There is no front daylight plane.

Variables.name: daylight_plane_reference_line
Variables.description: Fixed line from which the rear daylight plane is measured upward
Variables.notes: Rear daylight plane is measured up at the rear setback line.

Variables.name: daylight_plane_angle_basis
Variables.domain: angle relative to horizontal (assumed) or vertical (unspecified)
Variables.notes: Diagram labels 60° adjacent to the sloping daylight plane line, but does not explicitly state whether measured from horizontal or vertical.

Variables.name: side_daylight_plane_reference_line
Variables.description: Reference for side daylight plane (for cross-reference only)
Variables.notes: Side daylight plane is measured up at lot line; provided for reference to ensure correct application by plane type.

Constants.name: daylight_plane_angle
Constants.source: diagram label adjacent to the sloping daylight plane line
Constants.notes: Exact angular value given; orientation basis is not explicitly stated.

Conditions.if: Evaluating rear primary daylight plane compliance
Conditions.then: Measure the daylight plane upward starting from the rear setback line
dependencies: Correct identification of the rear setback line on the site plan

Conditions.if: Constructing or evaluating building mass within the rear yard subject to daylight plane controls
Conditions.then: Enforce a sloping plane at 60° from the reference line (orientation basis as adopted by the jurisdiction’s standard for daylight plane angles)

Relationships.description: Side daylight plane is measured up at the lot line, not the rear setback line
Relationships.logical_dependency: Use correct reference line based on which daylight plane (side vs rear) is being applied.

Relationships.description: Rear daylight plane is one of multiple daylight planes; front daylight plane is explicitly excluded.

Qualifiers.scope: Protrusions into daylight planes (rear and side)
applicability: Protrusions that penetrate into daylight plane envelopes on side and rear planes.
Rear protrusions are subject to the same rules as side protrusions.

Variables.name: protrusion_length_each
Variables.description: Length of an individual protrusion subject to maximum limit

Variables.name: protrusion_vertical_extent
Variables.description: Maximum vertical extent attributable to a protrusion
Variables.notes: Diagram label: 24' max (for protrusions). Vertical basis is implied by vertical dimension arrow.

Variables.name: cumulative_protrusion_length_per_side
Variables.description: Sum of protrusion lengths counted along any one side
Variables.notes: Bullet text: Cumulative length of protrusions must not exceed 15' on any one side.

Variables.name: protrusion_measurement_axis
Variables.description: Axis along which protrusion length is measured
Variables.domain: along building elevation; along daylight plane intersection; or horizontal projection
Variables.notes: Not specified whether the 7.5' limit is measured along facade, plan projection, or along the daylight plane edge.

Constants.name: protrusion_separation_min
Constants.notes: Minimum clear distance between adjacent protrusions.

Constants.name: protrusion_vertical_extent_max
Constants.notes: Appears twice on vertical dimensions; interpretation as vertical extent is inferred.

Constants.name: cumulative_protrusion_length_limit_per_side
Constants.notes: Cumulative cap applies on any one side.

Conditions.if: Design includes protrusions into side or rear daylight planes
Conditions.then: Each protrusion length must be <= 7.5 ft

Conditions.if: Multiple protrusions are used on a given side
Conditions.then: Maintain a minimum separation of 5 ft between protrusions

Conditions.if: Counting all protrusions on any one side
Conditions.then: Cumulative length must not exceed 15 ft
Conditions.notes: Unclear whether 'side' refers to a building elevation, a property side, or a segment of facade; clarify for automated checks.

Conditions.if: Applying protrusion rules to rear daylight plane
Conditions.then: Use the same protrusion rules as for side daylight planes
Limit vertical extent attributable to a protrusion to 24 ft
Conditions.notes: Exact datum (from grade, floor, or daylight plane intersection) is not specified; requires clarification.
dependencies: Jurisdiction’s definition of how protrusion height is measured

Relationships.description: Rear protrusions must follow the same standards as side protrusions.
Compliance requires the daylight plane geometry from the relevant plane (rear or side) to determine if and where a protrusion penetrates.

applicability: All structures, subject to specific conditions for roof slope, lot type, and flood zone.

Variables.name: roof_slope
Variables.description: Slope of roof expressed as rise:run
Variables.notes: Threshold at 12:12 determines base height limit outside special lot/flood conditions.

Variables.name: in_flood_zone
Variables.description: Whether structure is located in a flood zone

Variables.name: max_building_height
Variables.description: Permitted overall building height limit subject to conditions

Constants.name: max_height_low_slope
Constants.notes: Applies to structures with roof slope < 12:12 outside special conditions.

Constants.name: max_height_steep_slope
Constants.notes: Applies to structures with roof slope >= 12:12 outside special conditions.

Constants.name: max_height_flood_zone_cap
Constants.notes: Structures located in flood zones (except on substandard and flag lots) have a variable maximum up to 33 ft.

Conditions.if: Lot type is substandard or flag (any roof slope; any flood status)
Structure is in a flood zone AND lot is NOT substandard or flag
Conditions.then: max_building_height is variable up to 33 ft
Conditions.notes: Procedure or criteria to determine the exact allowed height within the 0–33 ft range are not provided; only the upper cap (33 ft) is specified.
dependencies: Jurisdictional flood elevation and adjustment rules (not provided here)

Conditions.if: Not in flood zone AND lot is standard

Exceptions.case: Substandard or flag lots within flood zones
Exceptions.outcome: Max building height remains 17 ft (no increase for flood conditions).

Relationships.description: Building must satisfy both the maximum building height regulation and daylight plane regulations independently.
Roof slope condition applies after excluding substandard/flag lot cases and before flood zone variability for standard lots.
